article.title: Muon Reconstruction in the Daya Bay Water Pools

multiple_choice_question.text:
This figure shows sketches of the Daya Bay water pools. Which of the following statements is **incorrect** about the pools?

**(A)** The pools are all 16 m long in the x-dimension and 10 m deep. 
**(B)** EH3 is wider than EH1 and EH2.
**(C)** The corner walls of the pools are at 45° angles to their neighboring walls.
**(D)** The inner and outer optical zones of the pools are separated by a layer of water.
choices: The pools are all 16 m long in the x-dimension and 10 m deep.
EH3 is wider than EH1 and EH2.
The corner walls of the pools are at 45° angles to their neighboring walls.
The inner and outer optical zones of the pools are separated by a layer of water.

multiple_choice_question.text:
This formula describes the calculation of the reversed and shifted PMT time (τ). What does the value '1100' represent in this formula?

**(A)**  The PMT's timing offset.
**(B)** A fixed constant used for all events and PMTs.
**(C)** The raw TDC value of the PMT.
**(D)**  The time resolution of the PMT.
choices: A fixed constant used for all events and PMTs.
The raw TDC value of the PMT.
The time resolution of the PMT.

multiple_choice_question.text:
This figure illustrates the geometry of PMT illumination by Cherenkov light. What does the point 'q' represent in this diagram?

**(A)** The location where the muon enters the water pool. 
**(B)** The point of closest approach between the muon and the PMT.
**(C)** The point on the muon trajectory where Cherenkov light is emitted, hitting the PMT.
**(D)** The point where the Cherenkov light cone intersects the water surface.
choices: The location where the muon enters the water pool.
The point of closest approach between the muon and the PMT.
The point on the muon trajectory where Cherenkov light is emitted, hitting the PMT.
The point where the Cherenkov light cone intersects the water surface.

multiple_choice_question.text:
This formula presents the calculation of the slopes and intercepts describing the muon trajectory. What method is used to derive these equations?

**(A)** Maximum Likelihood Estimation (MLE)
**(B)** Least Mean Squares (LMS)
**(C)** Monte Carlo Simulation
**(D)**  Chi-squared Minimization
